Home > external > kegg > getRxnsFromKEGG.m

getRxnsFromKEGG

PURPOSE

getRxnsFromKEGG

SYNOPSIS

function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

DESCRIPTION 

 getRxnsFromKEGG
   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database

   Input:
   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database

   Output:
   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
                       following fields are filled
       id                  'KEGG'
       name         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
                           expression is saved as the id
       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
                           associated to
       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
       ub                  1000 for all reactions
       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
                           reactions present in pathway maps the
                           reversibility is taken from there
       b                   0 for all metabolites
   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "spontaneous"
   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
                       undefined stoichiometry
   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
                       "general reaction"

   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.

   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)

 NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file

 ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
 NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
 DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
 EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
 REMARK      Same as: R06103
 RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
 ENZYME      3.2.1.28
 PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
 ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
 DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
 ///

 The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
 (except for '///')

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0002     isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0003 % getRxnsFromKEGG
0004 %   Retrieves information on all reactions stored in KEGG database
0005 %
0006 %   Input:
0007 %   keggPath            if keggRxns.mat is not in the RAVEN\external\kegg
0008 %                       directory, this function will attempt to read data
0009 %                       from a local FTP dump of the KEGG database.
0010 %                       keggPath is the path to the root of this database
0011 %
0012 %   Output:
0013 %   model               a model structure generated from the database. The
0014 %                       following fields are filled
0015 %       id                  'KEGG'
0016 %       name         'Automatically generated from KEGG database'
0017 %       rxns                KEGG reaction ids
0018 %       rxnNames            Name for each reaction entry
0019 %       mets                KEGG compound ids. If the equations use
0020 %                           stoichiometry such as ID(n+1) then the whole
0021 %                           expression is saved as the id
0022 %       eccodes             Corresponding ec-number if available
0023 %       rxnMiriams          Contains reaction specific information such as
0024 %                           KO id and pathways that the reaction is
0025 %                           associated to
0026 %       S                   Stoichiometric matrix
0027 %       lb                  -1000 for all reactions
0028 %       ub                  1000 for all reactions
0029 %       rev                 1 for reversible and 0 for irreversible. For
0030 %                           reactions present in pathway maps the
0031 %                           reversibility is taken from there
0032 %       b                   0 for all metabolites
0033 %   isSpontaneous       a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0034 %                       "spontaneous"
0035 %   isUndefinedStoich    a cell array with the reactions labelled as with
0036 %                       undefined stoichiometry
0037 %   isIncomplete        a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0038 %                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear"
0039 %   isGeneral           a cell array with the reactions labelled as
0040 %                       "general reaction"
0041 %
0042 %   NOTE: Reactions on the form A <=> A + B will not be loaded. If the file
0043 %   keggRxns.mat is in the RAVEN/external/kegg directory it will be loaded
0044 %   instead of parsing of the KEGG files. If it does not exist it will be
0045 %   saved after parsing of the KEGG files. In general, you should remove
0046 %   the keggRxns.mat file along with other KEGG mat files if you want to
0047 %   rebuild the model structure from a newer version of KEGG.
0048 %
0049 %   Usage: [model,isSpontaneous,isUndefinedStoich,isIncomplete,...
0050 %    isGeneral]=getRxnsFromKEGG(keggPath)
0051 %
0052 % NOTE: This is how one entry looks in the file
0053 %
0054 % ENTRY       R00010                      Reaction
0055 % NAME        alpha,alpha-trehalose glucohydrolase
0056 % DEFINITION  alpha,alpha-Trehalose + H2O <=> 2 D-Glucose
0057 % EQUATION    C01083 + C00001 <=> 2 C00031
0058 % REMARK      Same as: R06103
0059 % RCLASS      RC00049  C00031_C01083
0060 % ENZYME      3.2.1.28
0061 % PATHWAY     rn00500  Starch and sucrose metabolism
0062 %             rn01100  Metabolic pathways
0063 % ORTHOLOGY   K01194  alpha,alpha-trehalase [EC:3.2.1.28]
0064 % DBLINKS     RHEA: 32678
0065 % ///
0066 %
0067 % The file is not tab-delimited. Instead each label is 12 characters
0068 % (except for '///')
0069 %
0070 
0071 if nargin<1
0072     keggPath='RAVEN/external/kegg';
0073 end
0074 
0075 %Check if the reactions have been parsed before and saved. If so, load the
0076 %model
0077 ravenPath=findRAVENroot();
0078 rxnsFile=fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat');
0079 if exist(rxnsFile, 'file')
0080     fprintf(['Importing KEGG reactions from ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') '... ']);
0081     load(rxnsFile);
0082 else
0083     fprintf(['NOTE: Cannot locate ' strrep(rxnsFile,'\','/') ', it will therefore be generated from the local KEGG database\n']);
0084     if ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'),'file') || ~exist(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'),'file')
0085         EM=fprintf(['The files ''reaction'', ''reaction.lst'' and ''reaction_mapformula.lst'' cannot be located at ' strrep(keggPath,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP\n']);
0086         dispEM(EM);
0087     else
0088         fprintf('Generating keggRxns.mat file... ');
0089         %Add new functionality in the order specified in models
0090         model.id='KEGG';
0091         model.name='Automatically generated from KEGG database';
0092         
0093         %Preallocate memory for 15000 reactions
0094         model.rxns=cell(15000,1);
0095         model.rxnNames=cell(15000,1);
0096         model.eccodes=cell(15000,1);
0097         model.subSystems=cell(15000,1);
0098         model.rxnMiriams=cell(15000,1);
0099         model.rxnNotes=cell(15000,1);
0100         equations=cell(15000,1);
0101         %Temporarily store the equations
0102         
0103         isSpontaneous=false(15000,1);
0104         isIncomplete=false(15000,1);
0105         isGeneral=false(15000,1);
0106 
0107         %First load information on reaction ID, reaction name, KO, pathway,
0108         %and ec-number
0109         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction'), 'r');
0110         
0111         %Keep track of how many reactions have been added
0112         rxnCounter=0;
0113         
0114         %Loop through the file
0115         orthology=false;
0116         pathway=false;
0117         module=false;
0118         while 1
0119             %Get the next line
0120             tline = fgetl(fid);
0121             
0122             %Abort at end of file
0123             if ~ischar(tline)
0124                 break;
0125             end
0126             
0127             %Skip '///'
0128             if numel(tline)<12
0129                 continue;
0130             end
0131             
0132             %Check if it's a new reaction
0133             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENTRY       ')
0134                 rxnCounter=rxnCounter+1;
0135                 
0136                 %Add empty strings where there should be such
0137                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}='';
0138                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}='';
0139                 %model.subSystems{rxnCounter}=''; %remain empty cell
0140                 model.rxnNotes{rxnCounter}='';
0141                 equations{rxnCounter}='';
0142                 
0143                 %Add reaction ID (always 6 characters)
0144                 model.rxns{rxnCounter}=tline(13:18);
0145                 orthology=false;
0146                 pathway=false;
0147                 module=false;
0148                 
0149                 %Add KEGG reaction ID miriam
0150                 tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0151                 tempStruct.name{1,1}='kegg.reaction';
0152                 tempStruct.value{1,1}=tline(13:18);
0153                 model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0154             end
0155             
0156             %Add name
0157             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'NAME        ')
0158                 model.rxnNames{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0159             end
0160             
0161             %Add whether the comment includes "incomplete", "erroneous" or
0162             %"unclear"
0163             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'COMMENT     ')
0164                 %Read all text until '///', 'RPAIR', 'ENZYME', 'PATHWAY' or 'RCLASS'
0165                 commentText=tline(13:end);
0166                 while 1
0167                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0168                     if ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'///') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RPA') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'ENZ') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'PAT') && ~strcmp(tline(1:3),'RCL')
0169                         commentText=[commentText ' ' strtrim(tline)];
0170                     else
0171                         break;
0172                     end
0173                 end
0174                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'SPONTANEOUS'))
0175                     %It should start this way
0176                     isSpontaneous(rxnCounter)=true;
0177                 end
0178                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'INCOMPLETE')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'ERRONEOUS')) || any(regexpi(commentText,'UNCLEAR'))
0179                     isIncomplete(rxnCounter)=true;
0180                 end
0181                 if any(regexpi(commentText,'GENERAL REACTION'))
0182                     %It should start this way
0183                     isGeneral(rxnCounter)=true;
0184                 end
0185                 
0186                 %Go to next iteration if it is '///'
0187                 if numel(tline)<12
0188                     continue;
0189                 end
0190             end
0191             
0192             %Add ec-number
0193             if strcmp(tline(1:12),'ENZYME      ')
0194                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=tline(13:end);
0195                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=deblank(model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0196                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=strcat('ec-code/',model.eccodes{rxnCounter});
0197                 model.eccodes{rxnCounter}=regexprep(model.eccodes{rxnCounter},'\s+',';ec-code/');
0198             end
0199             if numel(tline)>8
0200                 if strcmp(tline(1:9),'REFERENCE')
0201                     pathway=false;
0202                     orthology=false;
0203                 end
0204             end
0205             
0206             %Add module ids
0207             if numel(tline)>18
0208                 if strcmp(tline(1:12),'MODULE      ') || module==true
0209                     pathway=false;
0210                     orthology=false;
0211                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0212                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0213                     else
0214                         addToIndex=1;
0215                     end
0216                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0217                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.module';
0218                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0219                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0220                 end
0221             end
0222             
0223             %Add RHEA id
0224             if numel(tline)>18
0225                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'DBLINKS     RHEA: ')
0226                     pathway=false;
0227                     orthology=false;
0228                     module=false;
0229                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0230                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0231                     else
0232                         addToIndex=1;
0233                     end
0234                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0235                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='rhea';
0236                     tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:end);
0237                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0238                 end
0239             end
0240             
0241             %Add KO-ids
0242             if numel(tline)>16
0243                 if strcmp(tline(1:16),'ORTHOLOGY   KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:16),'            KO: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'ORTHOLOGY   ') || orthology==true
0244                     pathway=false;
0245                     module=false;
0246                     %Check if KO has been added already (each reaction may
0247                     %belong to several)
0248                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0249                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0250                     else
0251                         addToIndex=1;
0252                     end
0253                     
0254                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0255                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.orthology';
0256                     if strcmp(tline(13:16),'KO:')
0257                         %This is in the old version
0258                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(17:22);
0259                     else
0260                         %This means that it found one KO in the new format
0261                         %and that subsequent lines might be other KOs
0262                         orthology=true;
0263                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:18);
0264                     end
0265                     model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0266                 end
0267             end
0268             
0269             %Add pathways
0270             if numel(tline)>18
0271                 if strcmp(tline(1:18),'PATHWAY     PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:18),'            PATH: ') || strcmp(tline(1:12),'PATHWAY     ') || pathway==true
0272                     orthology=false;
0273                     module=false;
0274                     %Check if annotation has been added already
0275                     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter})
0276                         addToIndex=numel(model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}.name)+1;
0277                     else
0278                         addToIndex=1;
0279                     end
0280                     
0281                     tempStruct=model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter};
0282                     tempStruct.name{addToIndex,1}='kegg.pathway';
0283                     %If it is the old version
0284                     if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0285                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(19:25);
0286                     else
0287                         %If it is the new version
0288                         tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}=tline(13:19);
0289                         pathway=true;
0290                     end
0291                     
0292                     %Do not save global or overview pathways. The ids for
0293                     %such pathways begin with rn011 or rn012
0294                     if ~strcmp('rn011',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5)) && ~strcmp('rn012',tempStruct.value{addToIndex,1}(1:5))
0295                         model.rxnMiriams{rxnCounter}=tempStruct;
0296                         
0297                         %Also save the subSystems names. For the old KEGG
0298                         %format, only the first mentioned subsystem is
0299                         %picked. Use the newer KEGG format to fetch all the
0300                         %subsystems
0301                         if strcmp(tline(14:17),'PATH:')
0302                             %The old format
0303                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter}=tline(28:end);
0304                         else
0305                             %The new format
0306                             model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1}{1,numel(model.subSystems{rxnCounter,1})+1}=tline(22:end);
0307                         end
0308                     end
0309                 end
0310             end
0311         end
0312         
0313         %Close the file
0314         fclose(fid);
0315         
0316         %This is done here since the the indexes won't match since some
0317         %reactions are removed along the way
0318         isIncomplete=model.rxns(isIncomplete);
0319         isGeneral=model.rxns(isGeneral);
0320         isSpontaneous=model.rxns(isSpontaneous);
0321 
0322         %If too much space was allocated, shrink the model
0323         model.rxns=model.rxns(1:rxnCounter);
0324         model.rxnNames=model.rxnNames(1:rxnCounter);
0325         model.eccodes=model.eccodes(1:rxnCounter);
0326         equations=equations(1:rxnCounter);
0327         model.rxnMiriams=model.rxnMiriams(1:rxnCounter);
0328         model.rxnNotes=model.rxnNotes(1:rxnCounter);
0329         model.subSystems=model.subSystems(1:rxnCounter);
0330         
0331         %Then load the equations from another file. This is because the
0332         %equations are easier to retrieve from there
0333         
0334         %The format is rxnID: equation The reactions should have been
0335         %loaded in the exact same order
0336         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction.lst'), 'r');
0337         
0338         %Loop through the file
0339         for i=1:rxnCounter
0340             %Get the next line
0341             tline = fgetl(fid);
0342             
0343             equations{i}=tline(9:end);
0344         end
0345         
0346         %Close the file
0347         fclose(fid);
0348         
0349         %Several equations may have two whitespaces between the last
0350         %reactant and the reversible arrow sign. The number of whitespaces
0351         %is thus reduced to one
0352         equations = regexprep(equations,'  <=>', ' <=>');
0353         
0354         %Construct the S matrix and list of metabolites
0355         [S, mets, badRxns]=constructS(equations);
0356         model.S=S;
0357         model.mets=mets;
0358         
0359         %There is some limited evidence for directionality in
0360         %reaction_mapformula.lst. The information there concerns how the
0361         %reactions are drawn in the KEGG maps. If a reaction is
0362         %irreversible in the same direction for all maps, then I consider
0363         %is irreversible, otherwise reversible. Also, not all reactions are
0364         %present in the maps, so not all will have directionality. They
0365         %will be considered to be reversible
0366         
0367         %The format is R00005: 00330: C01010 => C00011 Generate a
0368         %reversibility structure with the fields: *rxns: reaction ids
0369         %*product: one met id that is a product. This is because the
0370         %*reactions might be written in another direction compared to in
0371         % the reactions.lst file
0372         %*rev: 1 if reversible, otherwise 0
0373         reversibility.rxns={};
0374         reversibility.product={};
0375         reversibility.rev=[];
0376         
0377         fid = fopen(fullfile(keggPath,'reaction_mapformula.lst'), 'r');
0378         while 1
0379             %Get the next line
0380             tline = fgetl(fid);
0381             
0382             %Abort at end of file
0383             if ~ischar(tline)
0384                 break;
0385             end
0386             
0387             rxn=tline(1:6);
0388             prod=tline(end-5:end);
0389             rev=any(strfind(tline,'<=>'));
0390             if isempty(reversibility.rxns)
0391                 reversibility.rxns{1}=rxn;
0392                 reversibility.product{1}=prod;
0393                 reversibility.rev(1)=rev;
0394             elseif strcmp(reversibility.rxns(end),rxn)
0395                 %Check if the reaction was added before. It's an ordered
0396                 %list, so only check the last element If it's reversible in
0397                 %the new reaction or reversible in the old reaction then
0398                 %set (keep) to be reversible
0399                 if rev==1 || reversibility.rev(end)==1
0400                     reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0401                 else
0402                     %This means that the reaction was already loaded, that
0403                     %it was irreversible before and irreversible in the new
0404                     %reaction. However, it could be that they are written
0405                     %in diferent directions. If the product differ, then
0406                     %set to be reversible. This assumes that the reactions
0407                     %are written with the same metabolite as the last one
0408                     %if they are in the same direction
0409                     if ~strcmp(prod,reversibility.product(end))
0410                         reversibility.rev(end)=1;
0411                     end
0412                 end
0413             else
0414                 reversibility.rxns=[reversibility.rxns;rxn];
0415                 reversibility.product=[reversibility.product;prod];
0416                 reversibility.rev=[reversibility.rev;rev];
0417             end
0418         end
0419         fclose(fid);
0420         
0421         %Update the reversibility
0422         model.rev=ones(rxnCounter,1);
0423         %Match the reaction ids
0424         irrevIDs=find(reversibility.rev==0);
0425         [~, I]=ismember(reversibility.rxns(irrevIDs),model.rxns);
0426         [~, prodMetIDs]=ismember(reversibility.product(irrevIDs),model.mets);
0427         model.rev(I)=0;
0428         
0429         %See if the reactions are written in the same order in model.S
0430         linearInd=sub2ind(size(model.S), prodMetIDs, I);
0431         changeOrder=I(model.S(linearInd)<0);
0432         %Change the order of these reactions
0433         model.S(:,changeOrder)=model.S(:,changeOrder).*-1;
0434         
0435         %Add some stuff to get a correct model structure
0436         model.ub=ones(rxnCounter,1)*1000;
0437         model.lb=model.rev*-1000;
0438         model.c=zeros(rxnCounter,1);
0439         model.b=zeros(numel(model.mets),1);
0440         model=removeReactions(model,badRxns,true,true);
0441         
0442         %Identify reactions with undefined stoichiometry. Such
0443         %reactions involve metabolites with an ID containing the letter "n"
0444         %or "m"
0445         I=cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'n')) | cellfun(@any,strfind(model.mets,'m'));
0446         [~, J]=find(model.S(I,:));
0447         isUndefinedStoich=model.rxns(unique(J));   
0448         %Sort model that metabolites with undefined stoichiometry would
0449         %appear in the end of metabolites list
0450         metList=[model.mets(~I);model.mets(I)];
0451         [~,metIndexes]=ismember(metList,model.mets);
0452         model=permuteModel(model,metIndexes,'mets');
0453         
0454         %Sort model that i) spontaneous, ii) with undefined
0455         %stoichiometry, iii) incomplete and iv) general reactions would bve
0456         %ranked in the end of the model
0457         endRxnList=unique([model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isUndefinedStoich));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isIncomplete));model.rxns(ismember(model.rxns,isGeneral))],'stable');
0458         rxnList=[model.rxns(~ismember(model.rxns,endRxnList));endRxnList];
0459         [~,rxnIndexes]=ismember(rxnList,model.rxns);
0460         model=permuteModel(model,rxnIndexes,'rxns');
0461         
0462         %Add information in rxnNotes, whether reaction belongs to any of
0463         %type i-iv mentioned a few lines above
0464         for i=(numel(rxnList)-numel(endRxnList)+1):numel(model.rxns)
0465             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isSpontaneous)
0466                 model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Spontaneous');
0467             end
0468             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isUndefinedStoich)
0469                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0470                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'With undefined stoichiometry');
0471                 else
0472                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', with undefined stoichiometry');
0473                 end
0474             end
0475             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isIncomplete)
0476                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0477                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'Incomplete');
0478                 else
0479                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', incomplete');
0480                 end
0481             end
0482             if ismember(model.rxns(i),isGeneral)
0483                 if isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0484                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),'General');
0485                 else
0486                     model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),', general');
0487                 end
0488             end
0489             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat(model.rxnNotes(i),' reaction');
0490         end
0491         
0492         %Save the model structure
0493         save(rxnsFile,'model','isGeneral','isIncomplete','isUndefinedStoich','isSpontaneous');
0494     end
0495 end
0496 fprintf('COMPLETE\n');
0497 
0498 end
